item.title: Wuthering Waves version 2.2 update ‘Tangled Truth in Inverted Tower’ launches March 27
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/wuthering-waves-version-2-2-update-tangled-truth-in-inverted-tower-launches-march-27

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Smartphone

The origin of the second Dark Tide.

Kuro Games will release the version 2.2 update for free-to-play open-world action RPG Wuthering Waves, dubbed “Tangled Truth in Inverted Tower,” on March 27, the developer announced.

The company also announced that the PC version, currently only available via client download and Epic Games Store, will also be available via Steam starting April 29.

Here is an overview of the update:

  • New Main Quest
    • The Maiden, The Defier, The Death Crier
  • New Companion Story
    • A Fleeting Night’s Dream
  • New Regions
    • Avinoleum
    • Beohr Waters
  • New Echoes
    • Reminiscence: Fleurdelys
    • Nightmare: Lampylumen Myriad
    • Capitaneus
    • La Guardia
    • Sagittario
    • Sacerdos
    • Aero Drake
    • Electro Drake
    • Glacio Drake
  • New Phantom Echo
    • Phantom: Capitaneus
  • New Sonata Effect
    • Gusts of Welkin
      • 2pcs Set: Aero DMG +10%
      • 5pcs Set: Inflicting Aero Erosion on enemies increases Aero DMG for all Resonators in the team by 15%, and for the Resonator triggering this effect by an additional 15%, lasting for 20s.
  • New Tactical Hologram Challenge
    • Tactical Hologram: Dragon of Dirge
  • Optimizations
    • PC Launcher – The latest version of the launcher supports incremental content updates. This reduces the size of game resources that need downloading and the length of the downloading process.
    • Color Settings – Adjust the brightness, contrast, and color saturation of the game’s graphics.
    • Quick Access to Supplies in Backpack – When upgrading a Resonator, select “Supply Pack” on the “How to Get” menu and open the Supply Pack that drops the target Material, instead of going back to the Backpack to locate and open the corresponding Supply Pack.
    • Story Review – As you play through a quest, use the Review button to review the text for the part of the story you’ve just experienced.
    • Titles – Meet requirements to unlock Titles that mark your growth as a fighter and the achievements you’ve made along the way.
    • Exploration – The numbers of Waypoints and Casket Sonar that can be deployed simultaneously have been increased to 10 and 5 respectively.
  • New Resonators
    • Cantarella (5 stars)
    • Rover: Aero (5 stars)
  • Upcoming Featured Resonator Convene
    • Phase I
      • Neptune’s Lullaby
      • End of Lost Trail
    • Phase II
      • Till the Sea Turns Clear
  • New Weapons
    • Whispers of Sirens (5 stars)
    • Bloodpact’s Pledge (5 stars) – Complete the main quest to obtain the weapon.
  • Upcoming Featured Weapon Convene
    • Phase I
      • Whispers of Sirens
      • Red Spring
    • Phase II
      • Stellar Symphony
  • Special Events
    • Winds of the Past – Area Exploration Event
    • Avinoleum Travel Atlas – Featured Exploration Event
    • Acropolis Documentarian – Photo Collection Event
    • Gifts of the Still Tides – 7-Day Login Event
    • Virtual Crisis: Prototype Trials – Crisis Trial Challenge Event
    • If You Gaze Into the Abyss of Dreams – Featured Co-Op Combat Event
    • Lollo Campaign: Set Sail – Featured Commission Event
    • Ragunna Weather Forecast – Featured Platforming Event
    • Wuthering Exploration – Featured Exploration Event: Whisperwind Haven

Wuthering Waves is available now for PlayStation 5, PC via client download and Epic Games Store, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play. The PC version will also be available via Steam starting April 29.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds ‘Title Update 1’ launches in early April; showcase set for March 25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/monster-hunter-wilds-title-update-1-launches-in-early-april-showcase-set-for-march-25

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Mizutsune joins the fray.

Capcom will host a Monster Hunter Wilds Showcase on March 25 at 7:00 a.m. PT / 10:00 a.m. ET to introduce the first free Title Update coming to the game in early April, the company announced.

The first free Title Update will introduce Mizutsune as a huntable monster to the Forbidden Lands, as well as a host of other new additions.

Monster Hunter Wilds is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on February 28.
